    <string enum="0x1C481378" extra="0xFFFFFFFF" id="1131120" value="Notice of Report Request RE: &quot;Phantasma&quot;" />
    <string enum="0x6B4F23EE" extra="0xFFFFFFFF" id="1131121" value="Dear Ensigns of La Joya, &#xA;&#xA;It has come to our attention that contradictory rumors are circulating in La Joya. We have come to understand that a masked individual has been sighted trespassing on McKay properties after dark. We are also aware that some soldiers believe this individual is connected with accidents and malfunctions in McKay properties.     <string enum="0x5AB90D4F" extra="0xFFFFFFFF" id="1124905" value="Yellowed Journal Page" />
    <string enum="0xC3B05CF5" extra="0xFFFFFFFF" id="1124906" value="18 Febrero&#xA;&#xA;Tossed out of La Grande tonight. Time was, I was the hottest act they had. Not anymore. The Yanqui gangsters are taking over the country. Seems like black folk aren't their flavor. The money from the records has stopped coming too. I think they must have taken over the label.&#xA;&#xA;Well, Mamá would have said &quot;Ofelia, keep your chin pointed at the sun&quot;, and that's what I've done. Walked right into the label office this morning and told Miguel if he didn't give me the full back pay in royalties, I was out. He says, &quot;I don't need you anymore, now get me a drink&quot;. So I brought him a whiskey, but not before I pissed in it. Comemierda slashed my arm with his pen-knife after he spat all over his desk. Happiest I've ever been facing a man with a blade.&#xA;&#xA;I suppose it was only a matter of time before they found me at La Grande. Oh well. Even songbirds lose their voices, eventually." />

    <string enum="0x9BD6CB6C" extra="0xFFFFFFFF" id="1124989" value="EXPOSURE: Inhalation, ingestion, or contact with the eyes or skin. The chances of injury depends on the concentration of PG-240X and the extent of contact.&#xA;&#xA;INHALATION: The most common path of exposure. PG-240X is a highly water-soluble gas that deposits in the upper airway and is easily absorbed into systemic circulation, causing toxicity to numerous organ systems.&#xA;&#xA;INGESTION: Not common for accidental exposure in adults but occurs with children occasionally. Ingestion of PG-240X will cause extreme burns to the interior (and exterior) of the mouth, throat, esophagus, and stomach. Results in internal bleeding. &#xA;&#xA;SKIN &amp; EYE CONTACT: PG-240X can cause extreme damage to tissue and membrane by various mechanisms including low or high pH imbalance, chemical reactions with surface tissue, or removal of normal skin fats (defatting) or of moisture (desiccant effect). PG-240X is highly fat-soluble and is easily absorbed through the skin." />

Why do we love it? The holy trinity of flavors! The perfect union of sweet, sour, and, um, booze brought together elegantly in an ice-cold glass. &#xA;&#xA;It's easy to mix, and the flavor explodes in your mouth. &#xA;&#xA;Its invention is attributed to Jennings Cox, an American mining engineer sent to Cuba during the Spanish-American War. The story goes that he created it to protect workers at the mine from yellow fever, as both lime and alcohol were thought to protect against the disease. Most likely, though, he and his peers partied a little too hard and ran out of their usual gin, then fell back to what they had on hand to party a little harder.&#xA;&#xA;It is said he served the rum with crushed ice, put sugar on top of the cold chips, and pressed some lime juice over the sugar.     <string enum="0xAC127A82" extra="0xFFFFFFFF" id="989343" value="Hatchling Handling Guidelines" />
    <string enum="0x3276EF21" extra="0xFFFFFFFF" id="989344" value="Follow these guidelines to protect my babies from mishandling.&#xA;&#xA;1. Handle Daily: When handling a new hatchling, be aware that it may view you as a predator intending to eat it. Pay attention to the hatchling’s behavior. If it becomes distressed, then it may stop eating. Daily handling will make it easier to handle, feed, and clean.&#xA;&#xA;2. Picking Up a Hatchling: When picking up the hatchling, it’s best to try to pick up the animal carefully from underneath. Place a thumb on the rear leg or base of its tail to restrain it without restricting its movement. A gentle grip over the shoulders will prevent it from biting you. Never pick it up by the tail.&#xA;&#xA;3. Wear Gloves: Wear gloves when handling the crocodiles, especially when cleaning their cages to prevent infant illnesses. Regardless, never rush interacting with the hatchling or you may get bitten.&#xA;&#xA;4. The most important rule of all: love them like they are your children, your lover, or both. &#xA;&#xA;Anyone failing to follow these guidelines will suffer the consequences." />

Listening to radio comms didn’t clear anything up. &#xA;&#xA;It was chaos on the other end. Rumors of all sorts of things: Guerrilla transmissions claimed President Castillo was dead. Some said his son died with him. Esperanza was under siege, and President Castillo was leading the counter-offensive. &#xA;&#xA;Military channels were full of surrender and regroup orders. No one knew what was going on.&#xA;&#xA;Col. Sanz gathered the officers and pointed to territory on the map: Paradise Valley National Park. She knew the territory and it would be easy to hold. She ordered everyone to pack up their gear and get ready to move. &#xA;&#xA;Alpha Squad’s leader, Lt. Espiga, challenged Colonel Sanz’s orders. He argued for surrender. The colonel drew her sidearm and shot him. She looked us over while Espiga bled out on the ground, “Any other Lambs?”&#xA;&#xA;We all followed her to the valley." />
    <string enum="0x4ADBA6C3" extra="0xFFFFFFFF" id="1078486" value="{It took most of the first day to get the national park. We sighted a number of civilians on our march, but we avoided contact.     <string enum="0x3DDC9655" extra="0xFFFFFFFF" id="1078487" value="{The guerrilla attacks kept coming, and hitting our lines like they knew where to attack.&#xA;&#xA;The comms guy found the transmission by chance.     <string enum="0xAD638BC4" extra="0xFFFFFFFF" id="1078488" value="{After we disposed of the traitors, Col.     <string enum="0xBAA332B7" extra="0xFFFFFFFF" id="1078490" value="{The cook keeps ruining the flamingo by making stews with it. I’ve found a great way to cook it. &#xA;&#xA;After you’ve cleaned the bird, cover it with juice from a citrus fruit. I find lemon is the best. Then just rub the bird down with lots of coarse salt. Roast it in for a few hours with a really low fire. &#xA;&#xA;The thing comes out amazing. The skin is delicious and crispy. &#xA;&#xA;If you cook it in a pot, then you can save the juices for a soup along with the bones. Just boil the bones and toss in whatever vegetables you have on hand. &#xA;&#xA;It’s better than anything the camp cooks can make." />

    <string enum="0xBDCEF6AE" extra="0xFFFFFFFF" id="1078494" value="{Paradise Valley National Park is home to the world’s smallest bird: the bee hummingbird.&#xA;&#xA;The brilliant colors of the bee hummingbird's feathers are striking. The smaller male has a bright red throat, an iridescent chest, and bluish, lateral plumes. The larger female is green with white tips on their outer tail feathers. &#xA;&#xA;The bee hummingbird feeds mainly on nectar from flowers, and they are an essential species for plant reproduction throughout the valley. The pollen sticks on its bill and head transferring pollen from flower to flower. It’s estimated a single bee hummingbird will visit over 1500 flowers in a single day. &#xA;&#xA;Sadly, the bee hummingbird is a threatened species in Yara. Luckily, this habitat is protected thanks to efforts by government and international organizations. If this habitat were lost, then the species would quickly go extinct." />

The bank composed of smooth sand and the smell of blossoms moved the air. But a giant lived beneath the pond’s surface, devouring any who came to its edge. A warrior from the northern kingdom heard of the giant and vowed to slay him. He painted tatau on his body and took power from the land of the dead. And when he was ready, he walked the path of the lotus pond. The giant rose from the still waters. And the warrior raised his dagger. He cut the giant’s head clean off its body. The skull of the giant fell to earth and became our island. The descendants of the warrior became the Rakyat. Our people.”&#xA;&#xA;It is absolutely fascinating to see these different tales of revolt, and how they are told and reinterpreted. Born to Spanish nobility, he took to the seas to see the New World. After squandering his wealth, he was forced into piracy. Being a pirate suited him, and he began stashing his ill-gotten gains in the caves of Yara.&#xA;&#xA;An orphan in an English workhouse, Whiskey Gwen drank from a young age. Surrounded by hopelessness and despair, Gwen talked her way onto a privateer's ship. After a few years at sea, her captain died under mysterious circumstances and Gwen seized the command for herself. She became one of the most successful privateers in the service of the British Crown." />

Inform the subject their mother/father/spouse provided information for their capture to the FND. Observe initial reactions, follow-up with questions from their emotional response. &#xA;&#xA;2. Intimate that there is no alternative. Tell the subject that they will die in FND custody. Offer the choice of where and how the subject will die - adapt to the subject's background. &#xA;&#xA;3. Avoid direct questions. Let the subject reveal positions (either by direct confession or claims they know nothing). Allow the subject to direct your line of inquiry. &#xA;&#xA;4. Patriotism - cheap, easy, and often works on more rural or undereducated Yarans. Stress the fealty of national service; the choice to enlist will necessarily better the country. &#xA;&#xA;4.
